intro: Oritrophium peruvianum, commonly known as the Peruvian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes, thriving in cool and temperate climates. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Oritrophium peruvianum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
